intro: Astragalus lanigerus var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Astragalus lanigerus var. glabrescens plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
